meanings.definition: Relating to or derived from terpenes.
meanings.sent1: The terpenic aroma of the pine forest filled the air.
meanings.sent2: The essential oils had a terpenic scent that was refreshing.
meanings.sent3: The terpenic fragrance of the lemon was so strong, it made my nose tingle.
meanings.sent4: Her terpenic personality was as vibrant and invigorating as a field of wildflowers.
meanings.sent5: The terpenic essence of the cedar tree lingered long after we left the forest.

meanings.sent1: The terpenic properties of the plant made it a natural insect repellent.
meanings.sent2: The terpenic nature of the resin gave it a distinct smell.
meanings.sent3: She joked that his terpenic behavior was like that of a pine tree - always standing tall.
meanings.sent4: The terpenic qualities of the flower petals were as colorful as a rainbow.
meanings.sent5: The terpenic characteristics of the fruit made it stand out among the others in the market.
